rules.ruleString: For COURSE_CODE IN {2601} Do Permission required Otherwise true

(Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ECB1101, ECC1000, ECG1101, ECP1100, ECS1101, ECW1101, PMM2020} AND  Incompatible with course version in {1941, 2224, 3381, 4423, 4436} with course status in {ENROLLED})
Unit was previously coded {EC101, EC102, EC1021, EC1022, EC104, EC105, EC106, ECB1101, ECC1000%, ECF1100%, ECF2100, ECG1101%, ECO1020, ECP1100, ECW1000, ECW1101%, ECX1100%, GBU1101%}

description: Economics as an area of knowledge. Economics in a business degree. Understanding economic policy. An analysis of markets: supply and demand; consumer behaviour; firm behaviour; cost of production and profit maximisation; behaviour of firms in different market structures; evaluation of market capitalist economic systems, economic efficiency, market failure, government failure; current economic policies, competition policy, privatisation and the funding of education.
